intro: Synaedrys jordanae, commonly known as the Jordanian starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Jordan. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped white petals and adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments. The plant has a compact growth habit with short, hairy stems and narrow leaves. It blooms during the cooler months, typically between November and February. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
